newsitem.title: USA: INSIGHT-June U.S. T-bonds could be set for upturn.
newsitem.headline: INSIGHT-June U.S. T-bonds could be set for upturn.

text.p: June U.S. Treasury bond futures, having held key support at 106-22, could be set for a recovery, or at least a period of basing, technical analysts said Tuesday.
June T-bonds bounced off 106-25/32 in early trading Tuesday and were up moderately in afternoon activity. The 106-22 level was the low struck on September 19, 1996.
Richard Scarlata, editor of the Sutton Advisory Letter, said he has turned bullish on bonds on a 10-day, 30-day and 90-day basis after bonds reached both yield and price support.
"In my view, the debt market has already discounted the worst that could possibly happen in terms of the Federal Reserve and monetary tightening," he said.

He noted that June bonds reacted little to a string of stronger than expected economic data that included February construction spending and leading economic indicators and the March National Association of Purchasing Management index.
"If they get any kind of good news, which means slowing economic growth and better inflation numbers, they're just going to rally sharply," he said, referring to bonds.
James Grauer, president of Omnitrage, said that while bonds could see some further upside over the near term, they are more likely beginning a period of basing.
"For the moment, we have an extremely oversold condition," he said. "There's a very high probability of a bounce, and we're getting that today.
"But I don't look for very much on this," he said, adding that the market's near-term upside could be limited to the 109 area.
Scarlata said he expects a near-term move in June bonds to their March 25 high at 109-25/32 on their way to 111-28/32.
"The market has a tendency to come back to that level," he said of 111-28/32. "I wouldn't have turned long-term bullish if I hadn't at least expected that move."
Grauer said he is not bearish toward bonds but does not see a great deal of upside potential even though his daily stochastic chart is forming a "beautiful" bullish divergence.

"It's a case where the fundamentals are simply swamping the technicals," he said, adding that the market's basing pattern could last until the Federal Reserve has finished raising interest rates, which could come as early as May.
T-bonds(M): Support Resistance
107-02 Channel support 108-07 Approx 7.0 pct yield
106-22 Sept 19 low 109-22 March 13 high
106-18 Approx 7-1/8 pct yield 109-23 Trendline-early Feb
Eurodollars(U):
93.510 7-month low-Sept 19 93.790 March 26 high
93.200 8-1/2-month low Sept 6 93.880 200-day moving avg.
93.090 1-3/4-year low July 8 93.900 1-week high-March 25
